head.title: A Call for a Train Car For Cell Phone Users Only

hedline.hl1: A Call for a Train Car For Cell Phone Users Only

abstract.p: Alun Jones letter on Peter Applebome's January 7 column suggests some Metro-North train cars be designated for cell-phone users only

block.p: Regarding Peter Applebome's Jan. 7 column ''Repent, Commuters!'' In the days before smoking was banned completely from all Metro-North trains, it was permitted only in one or two designated cars per train. Given the extreme annoyance that the use of cell phones on trains causes the majority of riders, I would suggest that Metro-North institute a similar designation program.

Regarding Peter Applebome's Jan. 7 column ''Repent, Commuters!'' In the days before smoking was banned completely from all Metro-North trains, it was permitted only in one or two designated cars per train. Given the extreme annoyance that the use of cell phones on trains causes the majority of riders, I would suggest that Metro-North institute a similar designation program.
Make one or two cars on each train those in which the use of cell phones is permissible. Cell phones would not be allowed in all other cars.

If this were instituted, the majority of passengers would be spared the annoyance of listening to the conversations of those who seem compelled to be in communication with someone at all times. Perhaps, when they would be required to listen to all the other inane conversations being conducted, the cell phone addicts would appreciate what an intrusion they create.
